result.execSummary:
All charges against Derek C Fahrenkopf in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek C Fahrenkopf is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek C Fahrenkopf

records.addlTxt: 11:05 AM Defendant Derek C Fahrenkopf in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moved to dismiss case based on Initial Appearance in 22CF2674. Court granted. CASE DISMISSED.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MR or any of her family members
- Defendant shall not be at MR's residence, place of employment, or anywhere she temporarily resides.
- Defendant shall abide by the Injunction issued in Dane County Case No. 22CV1367 
- Defendant shall not be on the 200 block of in Brooke Dr. in Belleville.
Trial Judge - Br 2

9:47 AM Defendant Derek C Fahrenkopf in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
